channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Rare 18th century diamond necklace heads to auction – What’s the cost?
item.description: Sotheby's plans to auction a rare 18th-century diamond necklace in Geneva on November 11. Comprising around 500 diamonds and potentially linked to Marie Antoinette, the piece is estimated to fetch between $1.8 and $2.8 million. The necklace will be displayed in London before being shown in Hong Kong, New York, and Taiwan.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 5.6 magnitude earthquake triggers tsunami warning in Japan
item.description: A 5.6-magnitude earthquake struck near Japan’s Izu Islands, leading to a tsunami warning predicting waves up to 1 meter. A smaller tsunami of about 50 centimeters was detected on Hachijo Island. No immediate damage or injuries were reported, highlighting Japan's preparedness for such events due to its location on the Pacific “Ring of Fire.”
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: California mandates smartphone restrictions in schools to boost focus
item.description: California school districts are now required to create rules limiting student smartphone use under a new law signed by Governor Gavin Newsom. The legislation aims to curb classroom distractions and address social media's negative impact on students' mental health. Districts must implement policies by July 1, 2026, updating them every five years.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Widow of tech billionaire faces $250M lawsuit for ‘reputational damage’ following Bayesian Superyacht sinking
item.description: A lawyer representing the builder of the Bayesian superyacht that sank off Sicily has filed a $250 million lawsuit against Mike Lynch's widow. The Italian Sea Group (TISG) denies authorizing this legal action and seeks its withdrawal. The sinking led to substantial business losses and reputational damage for TISG.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: In Iran, old-time US radio detective 'Johnny Dollar' returns
US' Florida on high alert as Hurricane Helene approaches
item.description: Florida's Gulf Coast and Panhandle are on alert as Tropical Storm Nine strengthens into a potential hurricane. Governor Ron DeSantis declared a state of emergency for 41 counties to facilitate preparations. The National Hurricane Center warns of dangerous rip currents, storm surges, damaging winds, and heavy rainfall beginning Wednesday. Residents should make emergency plans and know their evacuation zones.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Venezuela issues arrest warrant for Argentina president over plane 'theft'
Iran's Guards ban communications devices after hit on Hezbollah: Report
Panic and chaos as Lebanese flee Israeli bombardment
Will Kamala Harris's $5 million daily outspending secure her victory over Trump?
item.description: US Democratic presidential nominee Kamala Harris is outspending former President Donald Trump by nearly $5 million daily. In August, Harris' campaign raised $361 million compared to Trump's $130 million. This financial boost has enabled her to dominate TV advertising as both candidates prepare for the November election.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I want to have some dignity': Terminally ill US woman plans assisted death in Switzerland
item.description: Gayle Hendrix, a terminally ill woman from Missouri with lupus and interstitial lung disease, is set to travel to Switzerland for a physician-assisted death. Despite family disagreements, she wishes to maintain control over her final moments and avoid further deterioration. US regulations on assisted death prompted her decision for this journey.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Diddy List: Names of celebrities connected to Sean Combs viral
item.description: A list of celebrities linked to P Diddy's controversial parties is circulating online, featuring names like Leonardo DiCaprio, Jay-Z, and Beyoncé. P Diddy faces serious charges of sex trafficking and racketeering. Amid the scandal, celebrities such as Usher and Megan Fox have deleted their social media posts, raising further speculation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Is Kamala Harris a Marxist?': Fake videos and AI images fuel communist claims
item.description: Kamala Harris is facing misleading claims associating her with socialism or communism, which exploit fears among voters from repressive regimes. Despite debunking efforts, manipulated videos and images are widely shared, especially in Spanish-speaking communities. This spread of misinformation has raised concerns and drawn criticism for its impact on public perception.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Confident Prince Harry shines in New York without Meghan Markle: 'They are living more separate lives'
item.description: ​Royal expert Phil Dampier said Harry and Meghan are living more separate lives and Harry is trying to carve out what exactly his future is. "He wants more fulfilling roles for himself," Phil said. ​A body language expert told Mirror that without Meghan by his side, Harry did not just blend into the background but showed the world that he was totally in his element.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'My staff says no...': Joe Biden invites young girls on stage at White House event
item.description: During a White House event honoring the 2023 National Women's Soccer League champions, Gotham FC, President Joe Biden acknowledged that his aides often restrict his actions, yet he chooses to proceed regardless. He invited young girls and boys from the audience to join him on stage, which raised concerns due to previous criticisms of his interactions with children and women.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Vivek Ramaswamy says he's worried November may have a rude surprise unless...
item.description: Vivek Ramaswamy said the Republicans became lazy and though they railed against the Democrats but without offering an alternative vision of the Republicans. "We're not up against a candidate here. We're up against a machine. We're not going to win this by obsessing over the other side's shenanigans. We're going to win this by answering who we are and what we actually stand for," Vivek said calling Joe Biden and Kamala Harris mere cogs in the wheel.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US is sending more troops to the Middle East as violence rises between Israel and Hezbollah
item.description: The U.S. is deploying additional military personnel to the Middle East as violence between Israel and Hezbollah in Lebanon intensifies, potentially leading to a wider regional conflict. The Pentagon has withheld details on troop numbers and missions. Meanwhile, the State Department advises Americans in Lebanon to depart due to increasing dangers.

item.title: 'Let me...': TikTok creator slams Kamala Harris, says unauthorised clip in Oprah’s interview
item.description: TikTok creator Blaire Allison publicly criticized Oprah Winfrey's town hall with Kamala Harris for using her video without permission. Allison expressed discontent with Harris's presidential ambitions and clarified that Winfrey’s team did not secure her consent to use the clip. Her comments about financial struggles faced by average Americans gained significant traction on social media.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Drunk passenger screams 'plane is on fire', handcuffed and strapped to her seat
item.description: An allegedly intoxicated passenger on an Azul airline flight from Recife to Viracopos Airport caused a commotion by shouting that the plane was on fire and would crash. Crew members restrained her after she resisted their efforts to calm her down. She was arrested upon landing for causing a disturbance. Azul airline issued a statement that the company follows the highest safety standards and regulations of national and international authorities
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: OceanGate used ‘absolutely idiotic’ hand-typed spreadsheet for Titan sub-navigation, says former contractor
item.description: A former OceanGate contractor revealed that the Titan submersible used a hand-typed Excel spreadsheet for navigation, which caused delays and raised safety concerns before its implosion during a Titanic expedition. The incident resulted in the deaths of all five individuals aboard, including OceanGate's CEO Stockton Rush, who used an acoustic positioning system for navigation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
